page.title: 01Farmland nr Castle Combe
page.content: The block as a whole is intensively farmed, all but 3 squares being given over to arable and pasture farming (sheep, cattle, grass, barley)Farms vary in size from 100 hectares down to smallholdings. A motorway M4 runs east west across the top of the block. The village of Castle Combe is a conservation area and contains about 50 grade 2 Listed buildings and a grade 1 market cross. Many tourists visit the village. Other buildings in the block are mainly of Cotswold stone with very little 20th century additions.Sq 10 contains the buildings of a motor racing circuit thats built on the remains of an old airfield. about 10 race meetings are held per year. Sq3 contains a 19th century country house that is now a private school. Most of the residets work in the area or local towns of
